message.content:
I'll calculate the financial ratios step by step based on the given financial statements.

## 1. Current Ratio
Current Ratio = Total Current Assets / Total Current Liabilities
Current Ratio = $20,314,894.50 / $1,015,922.54
Current Ratio = 20.00

## 2. Gross Profit Margin
Gross Profit Margin = (Gross Profit / Total Revenue) × 100%
Gross Profit Margin = ($5,718,450.67 / $20,318,450.67) × 100%
Gross Profit Margin = 28.14%

## 3. Debt to Asset Ratio
Debt to Asset Ratio = Total Liabilities / Total Assets
Debt to Asset Ratio = $1,015,922.54 / $30,858,088.75
Debt to Asset Ratio = 0.03

## 4. Net Profit Margin
Net Profit Margin = (Net Profit / Total Revenue) × 100%
Net Profit Margin = ($1,842,166.21 / $20,318,450.67) × 100%
Net Profit Margin = 9.07%

## 5. Cash to Current Debt Ratio
Cash and Cash Equivalents = Cash on Hand + Bank Deposits
Cash and Cash Equivalents = -$1,980,427.60 + $385,137.69 = -$1,595,289.91
Cash to Current Debt Ratio = Cash and Cash Equivalents / Total Current Liabilities
Cash to Current Debt Ratio = -$1,595,289.91 / $1,015,922.54
Cash to Current Debt Ratio = -1.57

## 6. Free Cash Flow (FCF)
FCF = Net Cash Flow from Operating Activities - Capital Expenditures
FCF = -$18,924,462.44 - $2,670,827.47
FCF = -$21,595,289.91

## 7. Return on Assets (ROA)
ROA = (Net Profit / Total Assets) × 100%
ROA = ($1,842,166.21 / $30,858,088.75) × 100%
ROA = 5.97%

```json
{"solution": {'Current Ratio': '20.00', 'Gross Profit Margin': '28.14%', 'Debt to Asset Ratio': '0.03', 'Net Profit Margin': '9.07%', 'Cash to Current Debt Ratio': '-1.57', 'Free Cash Flow (FCF)': '-21595289.91', 'Return on Assets (ROA)': '5.97%'} }
```
